text: Qutub MinarAlso spelled Qutab Minar or Qutb Minar. () is a minaret. It forms a part of the Qutab complex. This is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Mehrauli, Delhi, India. Qutub Minar is tall. It has five storeys. It gets narrower from bottom to top. It is in diameter at the ground. It is in diameter at the top. A spiral staircase rises 379 steps to twas top inside.It was started to built by Qutubuddin Aibak. It was finished by Iltutamish but when tughlaqs came the top most storey broke. Then Firoz Shah Tughlaq repaired it. == Related pages == * Qutb-ud-din Aibak == Notes == == References == Category:World Heritage Sites in India Category:Mosques in India Category:13th-century buildings and structures
title: Qutub Minar
